title: Immune mechanisms underlying delayed disease progression in HIV-1 and HIV-2 infection
abstractText: In order to design an effective vaccine against HIV infection we need to know more about how the immune system can combat HIV infection in people who have controlled the virus naturally without the need for drugs. We plan to study two groups of people where there are a large number of HIV-infected subjects who have low virus levels in their blood many years after being first infected, in China and West Africa.
